intro: Tretocarya pratensis, commonly known as the common tretocarya, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Apiaceae. It is characterized by its slender, erect stems and small, clustered umbels of white or pale yellow flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, open habitats such as meadows and riverbanks. Its leaves are pinnately compound, with finely divided leaflets that give it a delicate appearance. Tretocarya pratensis is often found in temperate regions and is valued for its ornamental qualities as well as its ecological role in supporting pollinators.
